intro: Tritonia karooica, commonly known as the Karoo bell, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. It produces a basal rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves and has a short, stout stem. Tritonia karooica is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in suitable conditions.
